title: Kemadrin Tab 1x100 (L)
details: Procyclidine is used to treat symptoms of Parkinson's disease or involuntary movements due to the side effects of certain psychiatric drugs (antipsychotics such as chlorpromazine/haloperidol).
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Asthma, emphysema, Diarrhea caused by an infection, Angina, Heart attack, Heart failure, Fast/irregular heartbeat, High/Low blood pressure, Chronic constipation, Ileus, Ulcerative colitis, Kidney disease, Liver disease, Anxiety, Dementia, Psychosis, Autonomic neuropathy, Seizure, Acid reflux, Hiatal hernia, Ulcer, Stroke,Hyperthyroidism, Problems urinating due to enlarged prostate, Neurogenic bladder, Overuse of or addiction to drugs/alcohol. This drug should be used only when clearly needed during pregnancy.
effects: Drowsiness, Dizziness, Constipation, Flushing, Nausea, Nervousness, Blurred vision, or Dry mouth may occur.

title: Alzilo 0.5MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: Rasagiline is used to treat Parkinson's disease.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Coronary artery disease, Heart attack, Chest pain, Heart failure, Stroke, Hypertension, Severe/Frequent headaches, Liver disease, Schizophrenia, Bipolar disorder, Depression, Diabetes, Overactive thyroid, Pheochromocytoma, Sleep disorders. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed.
effects: Dizziness, Drowsiness, Joint pain, Heartburn, Nausea, Dry mouth, Weight loss, or Stomach/Abdominal pain may occur.

title: Ronirol 0.25MG Tab 1x21 (L)
details: It is used to treat Parkinson's disease.
precautions: Use with caution having heart disease, Hypertension, Sleep apnea, Narcolepsy, Mental/mood disorder, Liver problems.
effects: Nausea, Vomiting, Drowsiness, Dizziness, Abdominal pain/discomfort, Headache.

title: Trivastal Retard 50MG Tab 2x15 (L)
details: Treatment of Parkinson's disease either as monotherapy, or combined with dopatherapy from the outset, or secondarily.
precautions: Consult your pharmacist or physician. To make sure this medicine is safe for you.
effects: Nausea, Vomitting, Dry Mouth

title: Paridopa Oral 100/25/200MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: It is Used for the treatment of Parkinson's disease and syndrome
precautions: Patients with chronic wide-angle glaucoma may be treated cautiously with SINEMET provided the intraocular pressure is well-controlled and the patient is monitored carefully for changes in intraocular pressure during therapy. levodopa must be discontinued at least twelve hours before therapy with SINEMET is started. In order to reduce adverse reactions, it is necessary to individualize therapy.
effects: It can cause Chest pain, asthenia, Cardiac irregularities, hypotension, orthostatic effects including orthostatic hypotension, hypertension, syncope, phlebitis, palpitation, Dark saliva, gastrointestinal bleeding, development of duodenal ulcer, anorexia, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, dyspepsia, dry mouth, taste alterations.

title: Pk Merz 100MG Tab 2x10 (L)
details: It is used to treat Parkinson?s disease. It?s also used to treat drug-induced movement problems, and to prevent and treat infection with influenza (flu) A virus.
precautions: Don?t take this drug again if you?ve ever had an allergic reaction to it. Taking it again could be fatal (cause death).If you have blurry vision or other confusion after taking amantadine, you should not drive or work in a situation in which you need to be alert or be able to move well. You should call your doctor if your Parkinson?s disease gets worse, if your movement disorder gets worse, or if your flu symptoms become more severe. If you?re taking amantadine for Parkinson?s disease, do not abruptly stop taking it. If you do, you may experience serious side effects, including agitation, hallucinations, slurred speech, and stupor depression. Dextroamphetamines, atomoxetine, methylphenidate, diphenhydramine, scopolamine, tolterodine, benztropine, triamterene-hydrochlorothiazide, quinine, quinidine.
effects: Nausea, insomnia, dizziness and lightheadedness

title: Dopacone 200/50/200MG Tab 1x10 (L)
details: Dopacone tablets contain levodopa, carbidopa, and entacapone and are indicated for the treatment of Parkinson's disease.
precautions: Keep it out of the reach of children. Store it below the room temperature i.e. below 25 degrees Celsius. Consult a doctor if you’re hypersensitive to any of its ingredients. Do not take overdose, always take it in a recommended dose.
effects: No side effects are reported. Consult a doctor if it causes digestive problems i.e. gas, bloating, abdominal pain, GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease), vomiting, nausea, or diarrhea, etc. Allergic reactions may occur i.e. skin itching, rashes, irritations, redness, & inflammation/swelling, etc. Other effects are drowsiness, dizziness, sleepiness, headache, etc.

title: Sinemet 25/250MG Tab 10x10 (L)
details:
Sinemet tablet is a prescribed medicine. Sinemet's generic name is carbidopa and levodopa, as it is a combination of both of the drugs.

Uses

Sinemet tablet's uses are listed below.

Sinemet for Parkinson’s disease symptoms
READ MORE
precautions: Some of the Sinemet tablet precautions are listed below.Before taking this medicine, inform the doctor about your medical history. Also, inform the doctor if you are using any supplements, such as herbal supplements.Before using this medicine, inform the doctor if you have any hypersensitivity problems such as allergic reactions, skin rashes, etc., from this medicine or any of the ingredients used in this medicine.To make safe the use of Sinemet tablet, inform the doctor if you are suffering from a heart problem, an endocrine disorder, liver or kidney problem, high blood pressure, intestinal problem, or stomach problem.The Sinemet in pregnancy should be used if your doctor allows it. Also, in lactation, inform the doctor before using it.Keep the medicine away from children and pet’s reach.Avoid the use of alcohol while taking this medicine.While taking this medicine, avoid the use of heavy machinery that needs mental alertness, such as driving.Before using it, check the expiry date of the medicine; otherwise, it can cause severe side effects.If you are using this medicine for a long period, then you will need regularly frequent medical checkups.Patients with chronic wide-angle glaucoma may be treated cautiously with SINEMET provided the intraocular pressure is well-controlled and the patient is monitored carefully for changes in intraocular pressure during therapy. levodopa must be discontinued at least twelve hours before therapy with SINEMET is started. In order to reduce adverse reactions, it is necessary to individualize therapy.
effects: Sinemet tablet side effects are listed below.It can cause some common side effects such as headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, constipation, dry mouth, and diarrhea.It can cause muscle problems such as muscle contraction, muscle stiffness, twisting, or jerky muscle movements. Also, sometimes the muscle movements are uncontrolled.Sinemet can also cause low blood pressure problems.It may arise from suicidal thoughts, depression, hallucination, mood swings, and behavioral changes.It can cause a shaking problem that may be uncontrolled able.Sinemet can also cause severe side effects such as severe nervous system reactions.It can also cause Chest pain, asthenia, Cardiac irregularities, hypotension, orthostatic effects including orthostatic hypotension, hypertension, syncope, phlebitis, palpitation, Dark saliva, gastrointestinal bleeding, development of duodenal ulcer, anorexia, vomiting, diarrhea, constipation, dyspepsia, dry mouth, taste alterations.
